bug.author: eliastsironis
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: I tried to follow the installation notes for GCP and I downloaded the blueprint with the command: kpt pkg get https://github.com/kubeflow/gcp-blueprints.git/management@v1.1.0 ./ Then when i tried to set values in the makefile i got the following error: /management/upstream/management: no such file or directory It seems like the upstream folder is not part of the package as i can only see the instance and a hack folder. What did you expect to happen: You should be able to set the values for the upstream. <denchmark-h:h2>Anything else you would like to add:</denchmark-h>
Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): 1.1.0 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): - Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) - Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): - OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): MacOS

It was a local issue with the execution of the make get-pkg command.
